intro: Cheilanthes valdiviana, commonly known as the Valdivian rock fern, is a perennial fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in the temperate rainforests of Chile and Argentina. This plant typically grows on rocky outcrops and in shaded, moist environments, showcasing its adaptability to rugged terrain. Its fronds are leathery and have a distinctive, compact appearance, with a dark green coloration. The plant is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils, making it a resilient and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
